fields.description:
h4. Summary
During the upgrade process, if there is an issue with the license, the following message appears in the log:
{noformat}If you have a new license, please enter it on this page (/<yourcontextpath>/fixonly/fixlicense.action) and restart.{noformat}

h4. Suggestion
It would be better if it were possible to update the license from that error screen _or_ automatically redirect users to update the license with the instructions to restart the Confluence site.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to update the license during the upgrade error screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Starting with Confluence 6.14, when the default language and indexing language is set to German, redirecting from quick Search to Advanced search via advanced search link, defaults to Custom Type instead of All content.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.14.* with new Quick Search, default language/indexing language set to German
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set default language and indexing language to German
 # Add a comment on a page
 # Search for the same comment in quick search
 # Comment is not found as comments are excluded from default quick search as per statement in [Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html] page.
 # Click Advanced Search to be redirected to Advanced Search

h3. Expected Results
 * Comment is found as Advanced search searched *All Content* types by default

h3. Actual Results
 * Comment is not found as Advanced Search switches to the *Custom* content type search that includes only Space, User, Page, Blog post and Attachment
 !quicksearch1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * No workaround at this time as it seems that even reverting the default language/indexing language to English will no longer resolve the issue.  

This issue is very similar to a recently closed bug, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58072.  The difference is the language setting.
fields.summary: With language set to German, Advanced Search defaults to custom type search if any content was searched prior to redirect

fields.description: Currently, there is no option to bulk import markdown files into Confluence. Though there are third party plugin available, we would like to see this feature inbuilt in Confluence.
fields.summary: Bulk import Markdown Files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Inspect Permissions page, when listing all names/groups will show a part of the full name. This makes it harder to recognize the user/group name if you have many of those that start with the same pattern

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user/group that has more than 20 characters
# Go to Inspect Permission page
# Click on *People* or *Groups* section and then *Show*
# The table will show a part of the name

h3. Expected Results
I expect a table that clearly and easily shows the full user/group name

h3. Actual Results
 !Screenshot 2020-02-28 at 15.29.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Hovering over the user/group name
fields.summary: Inspect User/Group Permissions shows a part of the user/group name if that name is too long

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Emojis are missing in a page exported to PDF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a new page
 # Use emojis in title or content, or both
 # Publish page
 # Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results

PDF content looks like the Confluence page, including emojis.

h3. Actual Results

 !Screen Shot 2020-02-28 at 13.13.51.png|thumbnail! 

*Notes*

Emoticons (e.g. after typing `:)`) and images export to PDF correctly.

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Issue Summary

Whilst using Google Chrome configured with Spanish (Latin America) as the primary language, there are situations where an error may be seen in the logs indicating the {{es-419}} is not a valid language tag. This issue is similar to that seen in [CONFSERVER-29922|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29922] which was fixed, but there are some additional scenarios where this issue arises.

Environment Notes
 * Google Chrome with the top language set to Spanish (Latin America)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Scenario 1
 # Install the Confluence Source Editor Plugin
 # Using Google Chrome, change the top language in Chrome to Spanish (Latin America)
 # Make a new page in Confluence
 # Edit the Page using the source editor, and submit a change

Submitting the change in the source editor will result in an error in the logs.

h4. Scenario 2
# Install the Confluence Source Editor Plugin
# Using Google Chrome, change the top language in Chrome to Spanish (Latin America)
# Edit a page, leaving the editor open
# In a seperate tab, navigate to Confluence and log out

The editor tab will continue to poll back to Confluence every 30 seconds resulting in an error in the logs.

h3. Expected Results

No 'es-419, is not a valid language tag' error in the logs

h3. Actual Results

Currently the error gets generated when we add this content.
 The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{code:title=Scenario 1}

 javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.text.ParseException: String, es-419, is not a valid language tag
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.HttpHelper.clientError(HttpHelper.java:273)

	javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.text.ParseException: String, es-419, is not a valid language tag

		at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.Status.variantFor(Status.java:304)
		at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.error.jersey.NotFoundExceptionMapper.toResponse(NotFoundExceptionMapper.java:21)
		at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.error.jersey.NotFoundExceptionMapper.toResponse(NotFoundExceptionMapper.java:16)

		at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1419)
		at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1409)
		at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.service(WebComponent.java:409)
		at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.ServletContainer.service(ServletContainer.java:558)
		at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:162)
		...
		at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestServletUtilsUpdaterFilter.doFilter(RestServletUtilsUpdaterFilter.java:34)
		...
		at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
		at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
		at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
	Caused by: java.text.ParseException: String, es-419, is not a valid language tag
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.LanguageTag.parse(LanguageTag.java:122)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.AcceptableLanguageTag.<init>(AcceptableLanguageTag.java:69)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader$8.create(HttpHeaderReader.java:434)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader$8.create(HttpHeaderReader.java:432)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readList(HttpHeaderReader.java:481)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readList(HttpHeaderReader.java:473)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readAcceptableList(HttpHeaderReader.java:452)
		at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readAcceptLanguage(HttpHeaderReader.java:439)
		at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.HttpHelper.getAcceptLanguage(HttpHelper.java:226)
		... 308 more
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no way to mitigate this issue directly within Confluence.

It is possible to work around the issue at the load balancer/reverse proxy level using a rewrite rule. The header provided by Chrome will look similar to 
{code:title=accept-language String}
Accept-Language: es-419,es;q=0.9,en-GB;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.6
{code}
The required pseudo code rewrite rule is
{code:title=Pseudo Code Rewrite Rule}
IF (accept-language.contains("es-419"))
    accept-language = accept-language.replace("es-419", "es")
{code}
This removes the {{es-419}} tag leaving only the {{es}} tag, whilst maintaining other language settings.
(!) This may change the Spanish dialect on pages received by Spanish (Latin America) users.
fields.summary: Using Confluence With Google Chrome In Spanish Causes Errors In Logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The new feature of Inspect Permissions is not matching the current user's permissions for a space.
h3. Environment

Confluence Datacenter 7.3.x 

.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 
 # Navigate to any space
 # Press *Space tools > Permissions*
 # **In the Groups section, click on *Edit Permissions* button
 # Remove all the permissions from the confluence-users group
 # Press *Save All*
 # In the same screen, at the Individual Users section, click on *Edit Permissions*
 # Type a user X that don't belong to the confluence-administrator group
 # Give this user only the following permissions:
 ## All > View
 ## Blog > Add
 ## Restrictions > Add/Delete
 # Inspect the permissions for the user X (they wont match).

h3. Expected Results

The expected results are that the inspect permissions shows the following for user X:
 # All > View
 # Blog > Add
 # Restrictions > Add/Delete

h3. Actual Results

The inspect permissions is showing that the user X have almost all permissions, as we can see in the attachment "Screen Shot 2020-02-27 at 17.34.06.png".

 
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Inspect Permissions does not match user permissions for a space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Spaces List macro shows a broken image if there are no favourite spaces.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert a Spaces List Macro
 # Choose "favourite" under scope of spaces and update the page.
 # Since there are no favourite spaces- It shows following message on the page with "broken image" instead of "star image" (star_grey.png)
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
|You currently do not have any spaces on your favourites list. To add one, click the _All_ tab and then on   !https://nivi.com/confluence/s/tadd65/8301/8fa50d05398fea29bc3b44b63cde07d279fbe836/_/images/icons/emoticons/star_grey.png!  next to the spaces you want to add as favourites.|
{panel}

h3. Expected Results

It should show the actual image than a "Broken" image and the change/remove verbatim "*To add one, click the _All_ tab*"  ** since there is no _ALL **_tab that is available for the users to select.
h3. Actual Results

It shows the broken image for (*) and the verbatim as described in Issue summary above which is incorrect.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Spaces List macro shows a broken image if there are no favourite spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35907].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
The only encoding that Confluence support is UTF-8
However, admins may change this setting in General Configuration > Formatting and International Settings
Setting Confluence default encoding to UTF-16 from this page will renders 'chinese' characters for spaces and even the login screen. 
It is also impossible to set it back to UTF-8, since the UI is not rendered
!utf16.png|thumbnail!

To verify this is the problem run in the database:
{noformat}
SELECT BANDANAVALUE FROM BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.settings';
{noformat}
if it returns a different value of UTF-8 in the result, then it is affected.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a new Confluence
# Go under the _Administrator Panel > General Configuration > Formatting and International Settings_﻿ and change _Encoding_ field from UTF-8 to UTF-16.

*Expected Result:*
Confluence doesn't allow the change

*Actual Result:*
Confluence becomes unusable, styles are broken and administration sections are locked.
Can't be reverted back unless a DB change is done.

h3.Workaround
# Shut down Confluence and perform a database backup
# Run:
{code:sql}
UPDATE  BANDANA set BANDANAVALUE = REPLACE(BANDANAVALUE, 'UTF-16', 'UTF-8') where BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.settings';
{code}
# Start Confluence
fields.summary: Disable changing encoding in Confluence administration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Extra characters are added to the  clipboard when copying content from Confluence editor
 *Environment*
 * Confluence 7.3.1
 * Host machine: Windows 10 pro, Google chrome 79.0.3945.130

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Enter page editor
 * Add following lines to the page
{noformat}
ls *
ls   *
{noformat}

 * Perform following test for each line:

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In Confluence, if there are multiple Jira links created, when notification is received in Confluence for one link, the link contained is always the primary Jira link.
h3. Environment

6.14.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create multiple Jira links in Confluence, such as below:
 Jira A
 Jira B (primary App Link)
 Jira C
 Jira D

When watching an Issue in "Jira A" and a comment or mentioning is done, that user gets the info in the Confluence "Notification Box". But this notification does not point to the Issue from "Jira A", instead it replaces it with a link to Jira B (which is the primary App Link).
h3. Expected Results

The link should be the link of the app-link through which the jira issue is being viewed.
h3. Actual Results

In the notifications (the bell icon at the top right)
 The link is always of that of the Primary link. So even if a jira link belonging to a different app-link.
h3. Workaround

The notification should contain the link of that of which ever app link the jira issue is connected to.
h3. Notes

(i) Confirm that the application IDs for the 2 Jira instances are unique, as if they are not it will trigger the same symptoms. [Change the server ID of one of the Jira instances|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-the-server-id-for-an-instance-of-jira-server-285839562.html] to resolve a duplicate serverID issue.
fields.summary: In Confluence, Notification shows wrong Jira link if multiple Jira links are used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While Confluence is connected to the database via DataSource, we will see the following error in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} despite the page publish successfully:
{code:java}
2020-02-25 16:31:18,884 ERROR [http-nio-6731-exec-6] [atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher] run There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.synchrony.ContentUpdatedEvent@f2a4df3d] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.service.SynchronyContentService.syncContentOnUpdate(com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.synchrony.ContentUpdatedEvent), listener=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.service.SynchronyContentService@6691a1d9} (timed)]
 -- referer: http://localhost:6731/c731/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=327693&draftShareId=2667a813-0d56-46b0-a249-45a6ecd709b4& | url: /c731/rest/api/content/327693 | traceId: 32b4e11053495fb0 | userName: admin
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.sal.spi.HostConnectionAccessor returned connection with autocommit set. Listener: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.service.SynchronyContentService event: com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.synchrony.ContentUpdatedEvent
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceListenerHandlersConfiguration$TimedListenerInvoker.invoke(ConfluenceListenerHandlersConfiguration.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher$VCacheRequestContextRunnableFactory$1.lambda$run$0(ConfluenceEventDispatcher.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.lambda$doInRequestContext$0(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContextInternal(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher$VCacheRequestContextRunnableFactory$1.run(ConfluenceEventDispatcher.java:93)
.....
....
....
....
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: com.atlassian.sal.spi.HostConnectionAccessor returned connection with autocommit set
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.rdbms.DefaultTransactionalExecutor.assertAutoCommitFalse(DefaultTransactionalExecutor.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.rdbms.DefaultTransactionalExecutor.executeInternal(DefaultTransactionalExecutor.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.rdbms.DefaultTransactionalExecutor.lambda$execute$0(DefaultTransactionalExecutor.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.sal.spring.connection.SpringHostConnectionAccessor.lambda$execute$0(SpringHostConnectionAccessor.java:55)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.sal.spring.connection.SpringHostConnectionAccessor.execute(SpringHostConnectionAccessor.java:49)
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence and [connect any supported database via datasource|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-datasource-connection-937166084.html]
 # Create a new page
 # Publish the page
 # Check the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}

h3. Expected Results

The page publishes successfully with no errors in the log.
h3. Actual Results

The page publishes successfully but with errors in the log.
h3. Notes

If 2 users are editing the same page this error is thrown when the first user publishes (or saves) the page and later when the second user tried to publish or save he will get a pop-up with the error "Can't sync with the server. Refresh the page to try to re-establish the connection.". Refreshing the page allows to proceed.


h3. Workaround
Configure the following attribute to your Tomcat datasource:
{code}
defaultAutoCommit="false"
{code}

Just as an example, here's a sample datasource configuration for PostgreSQL with this attribute:
{code:xml}
<Resource name="jdbc/confluence" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
                      username="conf744dc"
                      password="conf744dc"
                      driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
                      url="jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/conf744dc"
                      maxTotal="60"
                      maxIdle="20"
                      defaultAutoCommit="false"
                      validationQuery="select 1" />  
{code}

Confluence needs to be restarted so the modifications in {{server.xml}} are captured.
Also, if running on Data Center you must configure it on all nodes of the cluster.

Check the [Tomcat documentation|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-9.0-doc/jdbc-pool.html] for additional information on attributes to configure the Tomcat JDBC datasource.
fields.summary: Some users are unable to publish a page due to "ContentUpdatedEvent" Error when connected to the database via datasource configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on a preview of the attachment (let's say PPTX file) on a page, with an admin account, that does not have explicit edit/view permissions on a page, will result in 404, preview not find. Furthermore, the sandbox will not be triggered to generate the preview, if the preview was never generated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a single node DC instance.
# Create an admin (admin2) account that does not have an explicit view or edit permissions on a space.
# Create an admin (admin1) that has explicit permissions on that space.
# Attach pptx file and save the page.
# Check with the user admin1 if the preview is visible, and it will be visible.
# Now log out and log in with admin2 (user does not have an explicit view and edit permissions on this space).
# Click on the preview of the pptx file

h3. Expected Results
Preview will be visible.

h3. Actual Results
Preview will not be visible, and in Networks tools tab we will see 404
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-21 at 1.56.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Sandbox process for conversion will not be triggered.


h3. Workaround
The only known workaround would be to explicitly add the admin as an Individual or within a group that they belong to within the space permissions and configure that entry with Attachment Add permissions.
fields.summary: Clicking preview on attachment in page if using administrator account will result in preview not found (404)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The new Inspect permissions feature does not respect nested groups.  This also applies to the "people who can view" feature.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use an external user directory server
 # Have a user who is directly in group ChildGroup, which is a child group of ParentGroup
 # Ensure the user is known to confluence, e.g. by logging in as them.
 # Give ParentGroup permission to do something in Confluence. E.g. give ParentGroup access to view pages in a space
 # Inspect permissions for the user

h3. Expected Results
The permissions for the user should show that the user gets permissions from ParentGroup

h3. Actual Results
The permissions for the user disregard permissions from ParentGroup

h3. Impact & Workaround
To check if you are impacted by this issue, please run the following query on your database:
{code}
select s.spacekey as "SPACE KEY", parent.group_name as "PARENT GROUP WITH PERMISSIONS",  child_group.group_name as "CHILD GROUP"
from cwd_membership m, cwd_group parent, cwd_group child_group, spacepermissions perms left join spaces s ON perms.spaceid = s.spaceid
where m.child_group_id is not null
  and m.parent_id = parent.id
  and m.child_group_id = child_group.id
  and parent.group_name = perms.permgroupname
  group by parent.group_name, s.spacekey, child_group.group_name;
{code}
If this query returns one or more results, then you are impacted and permissions assigned to the resulting parent/intermediate groups won’t be recognised by the People who can view or Inspect permissions features.
(!) *Please note that this doesn’t mean that these permissions aren’t enforced, it just means that the Inspect permissions and People who can view features will not reflect them.*
If you are impacted by this issue, we recommend you go to *Manage Apps* and temporarily disable the *Inspect Permissions - Gatekeeper* system app. This will disable the People who can view and Inspect Permissions features, and prevent users and admins relying on information that is incorrect.
fields.summary: Inspect permissions and people who can view ignore parents of nested groups

fields.description:
At times, deleting a user from an external directory does not remove all the records/data belonging to that user. In this case, Confluence does not allow the user to be removed from Unsynced from Directory due to the existing record/data which is still referencing to the user. As an example, an issue is reported whereby few users are unable to remove from Unsynced from Directory as follows:
# A user is attempted to be removed from Unsynced from Directory
# This attempt failed and causes the following error:
{code}javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException: deleted object would be re-saved by cascade (remove deleted object from associations): [com.atlassian.confluence.security.SpacePermission#93022608]{code}
# The error shown above is mentioning that the user still has specific space permissions
# Due to that, Confluence does not allow the user to be removed from Unsynced from Directory

Though this kind of issue does not always re-occur, it would be better if there is a scheduled job that will remove all records/data belonging to deleted users from an external AD.
fields.summary: Scheduled job to clear leftover data after deleting a user from Unsynced from Directory

     <property name="attachments.dir">${confluenceHome}/attachments</property>

fields.description:
When running the Windows x64 installer for Confluence Server 7.3.1 (atlassian-confluence-7.3.1-x64.exe), the initial file extraction process stopped after a few seconds and the error message "Could not open file legal\._java.xml.crypto" was displayed.

!image-2020-02-18-11-35-17-996.png!

After ruling out a corrupted download and our virus scanner interfering, it turned out that we use ransomware protection that blocks *.crypto-files. We were then able to install Confluence by whitelisting this file name. Still, please consider renaming this file to something that doesn't use an extension that is commonly used by ransomware.
fields.summary: Installation process of Confluence Server 7.3.1 stops due to java.xml.crypto file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
German Team Calendar display text *Doesn't Repeat Ohne Wiederholung* while creating an event. It should display only *Ohne Wiederholung*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Could replicate this behaviour locally on 7.3.1 and 7.1.0
1) Click on Calendars
2) Create an Calendar Event
3) If you have German Team Calendar- The option "Repeat" display following text:Doesn't Repeat Ohne Wiederholung
4)  It should just display "Ohne Wiederholung" which is similar to "Doesn't Repeat" in English Calendar.
5)  Attached Screenshot depicting the issue.
 

h3. Expected Results
It should display only *Ohne Wiederholung* while creating an event under Repeat Option.

h3. Actual Results
Currently, German Team Calendar display text *Doesn't Repeat Ohne Wiederholung* while creating an event.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: While creating an event in German Team Calendar it displays text Doesn't Repeat Ohne Wiederholung . It should display only Ohne Wiederholung under Repeat option.

fields.description:
Right now, when adding a Issue filter macro to Confluence, the team column has team IDs instead of team names. A similar behaviour applies to XML exports.

The team column should follow a behaviour similar to Agile Sprints, where the name is shown in the column.
fields.summary: Team name should be shown in REST API/Confluence macros instead of just the Team ID

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We would like to restrict what users can do in the Confluence Server mobile app. As it stands, there is no way to change what users can and cannot do within the mobile app. In particular, we want to restrict:
 * The option to download attachments
 * The option to copy and paste contents

h3. Suggested Solution

_Add a read-only mode to the Confluence Server mobile app._ 
h3. Why This Is Important

_This is important to our users with security concerns, or who wish to restrict what can be done while using the Mobile App. The users would like to allow the use of the app, but to restrict certain features so they are only available within Confluence._
fields.summary: Confluence Server Mobile App Read-Only Mode

fields.description:
You can't have 2 same-titled names in confluence.

WTF... really?!

Right, it's mostly about the navigation.

Without having doubled page-titles there you end up with horrible long names, like:
"Navigation Point 1: Sub-Navi-Point 3: Sub-Sub-Navi 2: A name nearly 50% of pages have (like settings)"

THAT'S HORRIBLE!

Who had that idea to make a page name unique?!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence WebDAV client return Authorization Error on iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Configure WebDAV client for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-webdav-client-for-confluence-148044.html] on iOS using external application (for example [Documents by Readdle|https://readdle.com/documents] or [WebDAV Nav|https://www.schimera.com/products/webdav-nav-server/]) 

h3. Expected Results
Authentication successful. Connected to the Confluence WebDAV.

h3. Actual Results
User received *Authentication Error* while using correct credential. 

h3. Workaround
WebDAV connection work with [WebDAV Nav|https://www.schimera.com/products/webdav-nav-server/] iOS App despite getting the *Authentication Error*:
* [^webdavNav.mov]

h3. Notes
WebDAV connection failed due to *Authorization Error* on [Documents by Readdle|https://readdle.com/documents] iOS App.
* [^docbyReaddle.MP4]
fields.summary: Confluence WebDAV client return Authorization Error on iOS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 - Long string of text doesn't wrap and the text goes on indefinitely no matter the text size if you do not "break" it. Also happens with Tables.

h3. Environment
 - Reproducible in Mac OS X /Linux/ Windows
 - Reproducible in Firefox, Chrome, IE

*Steps to Reproduce*
 - Enter a long string of

text:cdjnvfjkvbfvldfbvfhvrdbvudrvudrhbvurdhvrdubhvrdhgvorhgiordbvriubvirbviodrbvd;
h3. Expected Results
 - Text will wrap according to window size.

h3. Actual Results
 - Text does not wrap if you do not break the line.
 - Per the image attached, the text goes on indefinitely no matter the text size.
 - Starts breaking when it is longer than the window size.

h3. Workaround
 - Break the text line using:

 # SPACE
 # ENTER
 # SHIFT+ENTER
fields.summary: Long string of text does not wrap in pages

fields.description:
Hi Team,

A given user when adding a label to a page, is allowed suggested with labels from across spaces. One can also see the labels tagged to Pages present in restricted Spaces.

I have seen a similar request raised initially under [-CONFSERVER-12638-|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-12638] 

h3.Replication and Observation:
Here is what I did on my Confluence ver 7.2.0-
 # Log in as UserA(with Admin Access to All Spaces) creates a PageA in SpaceA and assigns LabelA to the page and saves the page.
 # UserB(with access to one SpaceB only) logs in to Confluence and creates a PageB in the SpaceB and when begins to search to tag a label, UserB can see LabelA - even though the label was used in SpaceA tagged to PageA which UserB doesn't have access to.


h5.Expected Results:
The Label suggestion should not list the labels tagged to pages in restricted Space(s).
 

h5.Actual Results
User can see the label from a different space to which the user doesn't have view permissions.

Regards,
Venkat
fields.summary: Restrict Label Suggestion to Allowed Spaces/Pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Burndown Gadget render extra space after each refresh in Firefox

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.15.9
Jira 8.3.3, 8.3.4
Firefox 72.0.1 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) Replicate this using *Firefox* browser
# Setup Application Link between Confluence and Jira
# Add Burndown Gadget from Jira to Confluence
# Insert a Burndown Gadget into a Confluence page
# Waiting for the auto-refresh that is configured or click on the Refresh button manually

h3. Expected Results
Burndown Gadget refreshed with exact same width and length

h3. Actual Results
Burndown Gadget gain 40px white space at the footer of the gadget on each refresh
 [^Jira Burndown Gadget.mp4] 

h3. Information
This behavior is not observed in Jira 7.11.1

h3. Workaround
Browse Confluence using alternative browser such as Chrome
fields.summary: Jira Burndown Gadget render extra space after each refresh in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Servlets require CSRF tokens for POST requests.

But, at the same time, they do not support "no-check" headers, so it is impossible to send POST requests from JS code. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable html macros in Confluence
 # Add an html macro with JS script which sends POST request to {{<Base-URL>/plugins/servlet/oauth/authorize}} Note: "no-check" header should be enabled
 # Navigate to the page

h3. Expected Results

JS script should get an answer from the proxied resource
h3. Actual Results

JS script returns "403 XSRF Token missing message"
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: oauth servlets do not support "no-check" header for POST/PUT/DELETE requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When archiving more than one space, there are no spaces shown in the *Space Directory >> Archived Spaces* page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two or more spaces in Confluence (for example, *Space A* and *Space B*)
# In *Space A*, navigate to *Space Tools >> Overview*
# Click on the *Edit Space Details* link
# Change the space's status from *Current* to *Archived* and click in the *Save* button
# Check the *Space Directory >> Archived Spaces* page, you'll notice that the *Space A* will be shown there
# Repeat steps *2-4* for *Space B*
# Once more, check the *Space Directory >> Archived Spaces* page

h3. Expected Results
* Both spaces are shown in the *Space Directory >> Archived Spaces* page

h3. Actual Results
* No spaces are shown in the *Space Directory >> Archived Spaces* page

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: More than one space archived are not shown in the Archived Spaces page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When going to the Statistics tab in Confluence Questions, it appears the dates on the X-Axis of the graph are layered on top of each other making them impossible to read. See image below:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful to be able to filter the information by date in order to get clearer data from the report.

h3. Why this is important

The statistics page is really useful and has so much potential to help track the adoption of Questions. This is also the only option that admins have to generate reports for Questions add-on.

h3. Workaround

The is currently no known workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Add option to filter Confluence Questions Statistics information by date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Headers overlap breadcrumb navigation on pages that are long enough to scroll down on. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page that's long enough to scroll down on.
# Scroll down and watch the breadcrumb get overlapped by title header until you scroll past it.

h3. Expected Results
Breadcrumb navigation and headers shouldn't overlap.
h3. Actual Results
They overlap when scrolling down on a long page until the breadcrumb and header are off the screen. Scrolling up it works fine, This only happens when scrolling down on page in Chrome. Happens in incognito mode in chrome as well.  Could sticky navbar be missing for this Version of Chrome?

h3. Workaround
FireFox Works as intended
Safari: Works as intended
fields.summary: Scrolling down on a long page has page headers overlap breadcrumb navigation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
AFter a user upgrades to 6.13, there is log WARNings about duplicate packages. Users are unsure if there is a functional impact or if they should intervene in some way. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade from Confluence 6.6. to 6.13
# Tail the logs after 6.13 start up

h3. Expected Results
No warnings about duplicates

h3. Actual Results
You receive the following in the logs: 

{code}
2019-02-07 16:43:34,940 WARN [localhost-startStop-2] [org.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] logDuplicateWarning Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'javax.annotation' with different versions. Files: jsr305-3.0.1.jar and javax.annotation-api-1.3.2.jar
  '/data/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence-6.13.1/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/jsr305-3.0.1.jar'
  '/data/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence-6.13.1/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/javax.annotation-api-1.3.2.jar'
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes
There doesn't appear to be any functional impact to this other than creating uncertainty in the users and subsequently contacting support to ask for guidance on whether they need to address the duplicate issue
fields.summary: WARN about Duplicate Packages on Confluence 7.2.1

fields.description:
Often times, various changes in Confluence in the form of HTML/CSS customizations, installation of third party plugins, may (unintentionally) produce unwanted changes in the way data/content is displayed in Confluence. 

Often times, the end user does not know how/ or why the content that used to "look" on way, suddenly look differently which causes frustrations, especially if the new look distorts the content significantly from how the author originally wants it to look like. 

It would be great addition to Confluence if:
# Confluence would automatically detect that certain customisation changes _might_ affect the look and feel of a content and then notifies authors in this regards. 
# This will help authors verify if there are any changes in the look of their content and as such help them either to edit the content to suite the new look or help them notify the admins of their respective Confluence instances that a recent customisation or plugin has caused their content to behave in a different way.
fields.summary: Provide a feature that notifies users when a change in Confluence may affect the look of their content.

fields.description:
Unlike Confluence Server, it's not possible to start Confluence Data Center in Safe Mode, as also indicated on the KB article below:
 * [How to manually remove malfunctioning add-ons|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-remove-malfunctioning-add-ons-113705118.html]

It would be helpful to have such feature on Confluence Data Center, since the only way of disabling plugins currently available is by accessing the database and running a SQL query, which requires a database backup as a good practice.
fields.summary: Start Confluence Data Center in Safe Mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Since Confluence 5.5, previous Remote APIs, such as JSON-RPC and XML-RPC, have been deprecated and are no longer supported. However, many of the methods available through these API endpoints have not been ported over to the REST API, which is now being utilized.

This can cause issues for any users that were utilizing these older endpoints and are unable to make the switch to the REST API.

While it's technically possible for users to still use the older API endpoints,  it's not specifically stated if these endpoints will be made available in the REST API or if at all, and is also another concern.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create equivalent endpoints in the REST API to match what is available through the older Remote APIs.

h3. Workaround

Depending on the specific functions needed, the Confluence CLI can provide many of the same functionality, but it is a paid third-party add-on.
fields.summary: Update the REST API to allow for more endpoints to match previous offerings.
Page Operations Menu display can be too long for low-resolution settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a new user is created in Confluence, the user is sent a welcome email with the following content:

{code}
Hi,

Join me and the rest of the team on Confluence!

It's the one place to create, share, discuss and store our ideas, projects and documents.

You will send less email, have fewer meetings and get more done.

Please accept this invitation to get started!
{code}

There is currently no way to disable this email being sent to the new user. There is a setting, which allows the Administrator to not receive this email, but not the user.
h3. Suggested Solution

_There should be a notification setting, that can be disabled so that users do not receive email for this particular event. There is currently no direct way to achieve this._ 
h3. Why This Is Important

_This is important as we do see customers interested in disabling this option, not just for administrators, but also for normal users._
h3. Workaround

_There is currently no workaround to achieve this._
fields.summary: Disabling user account welcome notification email

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The first image that is posted in an Answer to a Confluence Question cannot be copied and pasted to a new response.

The second, third, and subsequent images that are posted as CQ Answers *_are_* able to be copied and pasted into new responses.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.13.9, Confluence Questions 2.7.20
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence Question
 # Create a new answer to that question that includes an image
 # Create a second new answer
 # Select the image and the text of the first answer
 # Paste the image and text of the first answer into the second (or subsequent) answer
 # Receive "Oops - an error has occurred" message and notice that the answer was not posted

h3. Expected Results

The second answer is attached and no error is thrown
h3. Actual Results

User receives "Oops - an error has occurred"
 Application logs show OptimisticLockingFailureException:
{code:java}
2020-01-21 01:30:00,139 WARN [Caesium-1-4] [impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper] runJob Scheduled job confluence.extra.webdav:confluenceDavSessionInvalidatorJob#confluenceDavSessionInvalidatorJobTrigger completed unsuccessfully with response JobRunnerResponse[runOutcome=FAILED,message='HibernateOptimisticLockingFailureException: Object of class [java.lang.Object] with identifier [null]: optimistic locking failed; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.StaleObjectStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; a']
{code}
h3. Workaround

Download the image and re-upload it instead of copying it from the first answer.
h3. Notes

I can reproduce this issue in my test environment on every attempt.
fields.summary: Copying the first image that is posted as an answer to a Confluence Question into a new answer results in an error.

fields.summary: Child page navigator does not show the full list of pages when resolution/scaling changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary * The Jira Status Report template in Confluence doesn't render the *Overall status*, *Priority*, *Component* and *Issue Type* pie charts of it. h3. Steps to Reproduce # In Confluence, click on *... >> Jira Report >> Status Report* # Select the Jira project # Create the page # Publish the page h3. Expected Results * The pie charts render the results related to the selected Jira project h3. Actual Results * The pie charts won't render the results. The following warning message is shown instead: {quote}java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: parameter value cannot be null {quote} * Checking the chart's storage format: {code:java} -- default pie chart of the blueprint

trueTESTprioritiespie

{code} * If the pie chart, for the same project, is added to the same page, the results are rendered correctly, and here's the storage format of the chart: {code:java} -- manually added pie chart

falsefalseTESTproject%20%3D%20%22TEST%22prioritiespietrue

jirareport {code} ** If we compare both storage formats, we'll notice that the default pie chart is missing the *ac:name="jql"* parameter. h3. Notes * Confluence 7.1.2 is using the *Confluence Jira Plugin v11.0.12* h3. Workaround * Replace the *Confluence Jira Plugin v11.0.12* with an earlier version, *Confluence Jira Plugin v11.0.11*. To replace this plugin, you'll need to: ## Navigate to your <*installation directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins.* ## Copy off the *confluence-jira-plugin-11.0.12.jar* file to a safe location and then delete it from the folder. ## Next, copy in the [^confluence-jira-plugin-11.0.11.jar] file to the <*installation directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins* folder  and ensure that the file has the same permissions and ownership as other jar files in this folder. ## Restart your Confluence instance. *OR* * Manually add the pie chart macro to the affected page
fields.summary: Jira Status Report blueprint it's not rendering the pie charts' content

2020-02-06 09:35:43,007 INFO [Catalina-utility-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 7.3.1 [build 8401 based on commit hash c06149f9b8308a0beb580e4deed399f7fb2d372d] - synchrony version 3.1.0-master-0f086db5
WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
WARNING: Illegal reflective access by com.atlassian.hibernate.adapter.proxy.BytecodeProviderImpl_ImplementV2Proxy (file:/CONF/atlassian/confluence/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/hibernate.adapter-1.0.3.jar\) to field java.lang.reflect.Field.modifiers
{code}
We under stand that this error message was introduced from Java 1.9. Even-though the latest versions of Confluence are compatible till Java 11 and some of the docker and standalone installer versions come packaged with this version.
h3. Environment

Noticed this in 7.3.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce

User standalone installer of Confluence 7.3.1 for either Windows or Linux. This error is noted in random or during upgrade.

No error is expected.

Observing the error message noted above.
h3. Workaround

None.
h3. Notes

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# In Confluence,we can create links to page that do not exist yet.
** [Undefined Page Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/undefined-page-links-139580.html]
# While we can view the list of Undefined Page links in Confluence in the Space admin page, to remove these links, we'll have to open the page and remove the links.

h4. Suggestion
# Have the ability to bulk remove these undefined page links from the Undefined Pages section.
fields.summary: Option to bulk remove links to undefined page

fields.description:
Currently, you can perform a search for the usage of a macro on a page.  

It would be helpful if a search could be done for the parameter value used within that macro.

For example, perform a search for all pages using the excerpt-include macro that is pulling in an excerpt from the page 'Best Practices'.

macroName:excerpt-include:page=ABC:Best Practices
fields.summary: Confluence Search - Allow entry of a Parameter Value for a Macro

fields.description:
There are instances where customers would like to remove every instance of a macro from all Confluence pages. 

The current only procedure users can do, is to head over to each page and remove these macros one by one which is not ideal especially if there are a lot of spaces and pages to be covered. 

h5. The ask:
Provide a feature that allows users to bulk remove macros from space level or global level.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to bulk remove a particular macro from a Confluence instance.

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

I've been a fan of your tools for the last decade, and regard very positively the evolution in the products and growth of you offers.

However, the matching users licence policy is now completely outdate, and I strongly suggest you review it. Given the high number of plugins Confluence available, it happens quite often that we would like to start using a given plugin for on of our company's divisions only, limiting the licence (and price) of the plugin.

Due to your matching licences policy, this is not possible, which many times stops us from getting additional products complementing your tools.

IMHO, one of the main reasons for Atlassian's products success is the highly flexible and usable User Management approach, but oddly enough, the matching licences policy is a big obstacle to going deeper into the Atlassian ecosystem.

I therefore suggest you implement a more flexible licensing policy, where the system admin can 1) choose a sub-set of users from Confluence licence which have access to a given plugin, or 2) select all users if the licences match.
fields.summary: Drop matching licences policy asap, please!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Hello Team, one of our customer and I were able to find a behavioural issue with Confluence and the Label List Macro.

A page when created with View and Edit Restrictions only to Admins and the Creator tagged to a label, the label(tagged to above restricted content) is listed in the 'Label List' macro when a different user creates a page with label list macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as UserA creates a PageA with the LabelA and saves the page.
 # The PageA has a Viewing and Editing Restrictions with only UserA with Edit and View access.
 # UserB logs in to Confluence and lists down the pages in the same SPACE and doesn't see PageA.
 # UserB creates a page and uses the Label-List macro to list down all the labels tagged to pages in that SPACE and the does see LabelA listed.
 # However UserB clicks on the [#LabelA] ends up seeing-
{panel}
h4. Labelled content

There are no pages at the moment.
{panel}

h3.Expected Results:

The Label List macro's list should not list the labels tagged to restricted pages and content.
  
h3. Actual Results

The Label List Macro does list down the labels which are tagged to restricted Content(Page) thereby resulting in the message - _There are no pages at the moment_ when the disallowed users click on the label.
h3. Workaround

—

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Label List macro should not list labels tagged to pages with View and Edit restriction

h3. Summary
The user seeing broken PDF comments after uploading the PDF file in a Confluence page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a PDF and [add comments|https://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/feature-details/acrobatpro/pdfs/adding-comments-to-a-pdf-document.pdf]
# Create a page
# Add the PDF file created in step 1
# Click on the PDF file to view it

h3. Actual Results
!pdf_comment.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to see the PDF comments

h3. Notes
An extended improvement would be to have PDF's Inline comment incorporated together with Confluence's Inline Comment feature on the read and write of the PDF documents.
fields.summary: Support PDF Inline Comment in File Previews

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If Google Translate Extension is installed in the browser, having text selected when saving/updating a page will cause the extension's icon to be added to the bottom of the page.

This icon cannot be removed later when editing again.
h3. Environment
 * Any Confluence version after 6.13
 * Chrome browser
 * Google Translate Extension installed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page;
 # Set the Translate Extension options to a different language than the one in Confluence and to display icon;
 # Edit the page, add some text and click on *Update* without any text selected;
 # Edit again, select some text and click on *Update*;
 # Edit again and check for the presence of the icon;
 # You need to open in *Source Editor* to remove the section containing the icon.

Check the attached video for details.
h3. Expected Results

The extension's icon, that is not displayed when the Editor is open, should not be added to the page's storage format when text is selected.
h3. Actual Results

The extension's icon is added to the page's storage format and visible when viewing the page but not when editing.
h3. Workaround

Set the Google Translate Extension option to "Don't display icon or pop-up" to prevent this issue.

For pages where the icon was added, use the free [Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?hosting=server&tab=overview] app to remove the icon's section, as seen on the attached video.
fields.summary: Google Translate Extension's icon added to the bottom of the page after editing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Many users that encounter issues with missing file system based attachments end up having to utilize our python script here:

* [How to resolve missing attachments in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-resolve-missing-attachments-in-confluence-201761.html]

This is not always an ideal process for users as it requires Python to be installed on the environment that may be locked down for security. 

The process itself can also lead to issues, as there are several different factors (SQL queries, running the script, permissions, etc) that can lead to issues.

h3. Suggested Solution

A more painless solution to this issue would be to implement the Missing Attachments script  (written in Java) within Confluence. This would help provide a clearer process for users to resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Provide In-House solution for Missing Attachments Script

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Notification email of multiple Edit on Pages send an email stating: "There's 14 new edits on this page".

When multiple edits are made, multiple emails are sent, with the incorrect wording.
h3. Environment

Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit multiple pages.
 # Check the notification emails.

h3. Expected Results

The notification email should be grammatically correct, if there are more then one change, 
 it should be "There are" or simply remove the "There's" from the sentence.
h3. Actual Results

The notification email writes: "There's XX new edits on this page"
h3. Workaround

_._

Notes
fields.summary: Notification Email Grammatically Incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a new attachment, Confluence is looping to retrieve all versions of the same attachment and to delete all thumbnails for the historical attachment. This might cause a performance issue on Azure when there is a large number of versions of the same attachment. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy a Confluence instance on Azure
 # Create a page and add the same attachment 200 times.
 # Add the same attachment again.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment should be added instantly.
h3. Actual Results

The operation reach the session timeout and it failed to add the attachment
h3. Workaround

Reduce the number of versions on the same attachment.
fields.summary: Looping over/deleting all old version thumbnails when attaching file

h3. Issue Summary
When a PowerPoint file is attached on a page, the thumbnail is garbled into random characters.
Environment:
* CentOS7 (3.10.0-1062.9.1.el7.x86_64)
* Confluence 6.13.9
* java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.232.b09-0.el7_7.x86_64

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 6.13.9 in CentOS7 (3.10.0-1062.9.1.el7.x86_64)
# Change {{JRE_HOME}} in {{setjre.sh}} to point to the directory of {{jre}} of {{java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.232.b09-0.el7_7.x86_64}}
# Start Confluence
# Attach any PowerPoint file on a page
# Review the results

h3. Expected Results
 !confluence-test-in-CentOS7.png|thumbnail! 
* Thumbnail on-page should be showing correctly.

h3. Actual Results
 !confluence-test-in-CentOS7actual.png|thumbnail! 
* Thumbnail appears to be garbled as random characters.

h3. Workaround
# The behavior is tested on a couple of java version and the issue is not present on {{java 1.8.0_202-b08}} and {{java 1.8.0_222-b10}}.
# The issue is affecting {{java 1.8.0_232-b09}} and {{java 1.8.0_242-b08}}.
# It is assumed that issue is affecting {{java version}} beyond {{1.8.0_222-b10}}.
# *Current workaround* is to either:
** Stay on {{java 1.8.0_202-b08}} or {{java 1.8.0_222-b10}}.
** Use the bundled java for Confluence.
fields.summary: Text on PowerPoint's thumbnail appears to be garbled on CentOS7

fields.description:
Currently, email notifications do not include any images or other attachments. Instead, an empty box is shown with a question mark. This is confusing and visually unattractive. Besides, it gives end users the impression that Confluence is not working properly.

People have been complaining about this for years, both in the Confluence and JIRA forums. See e.g. [this Confluence thread |https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-9443?focusedCommentId=426627&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-426627] and [this JIRA thread|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41675]

So why not add an option to the mail server configuration settings under Administration > General Configuration > Mail Servers, to strip all images / attachments from email notifications? This would be an elegant solution for end users (who would rather see no images at all than broken images) and also means no complex solution has to be built for handling permissions to download / view images from restricted Confluence posts or pages.
fields.summary: Add option to strip images from email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Texts in powerpoint thumbnail is not rendered correctly depending on Java version. Characters are overlaid each other. 
 As far as I confirmed,
 * (/) [AdoptOpenJDK jdk8u202-b08|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html] (which is a [bundled one in most version of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/bundled-tomcat-and-java-versions-1005786018.html]) can render correctly
 * (/) [Oracle JRE jre-8u241-linux-x64|https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jre8-downloads-2133155.html] can render correctly
 * (x) [AdoptOpenJDK jdk8u242-b08|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html] is affected
 * (x) [AdoptOpenJDK jdk-11.0.6+10|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html] is affected
 * (x) [AdoptOpenJDK jdk-11.0.5+10|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html] is affected (it's bundled with 7.4.0)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare Linux OS and install some fonts to enable server side rendering
{code:bash|title=I've tested with Ubuntu}
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y fontconfig
apt-get install -y fonts-dejavu
{code}

 # Install Confluence from tar.gz and configure it to use *[AdoptOpenJDK jdk8u242-b08|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html]*
 # Open the editor, and drag and drop [^sample.pptx] on your browser.

h3. Expected Results

[^sample.pptx] is rendered correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The text is squashed. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-05 at 11.50.49.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use jdk8u202-b08 as [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html] suggests.
{quote}Some AdoptOpenJDK versions have bugs that impact Confluence. We recommend version jdk8u202 (see CONFSERVER-58784).
{quote}
Or, if you are already using Java 11, upgrade to version 11.0.7.

Note: Confluence LTS version 7.4.3 and later is bundled with AdoptOpenJDK version 11.0.7+10, which is unaffected by this bug. However, if Confluence is running using an older JDK version which is affected, the bug will still be experienced.
fields.summary: Texts in powerpoint thumbnail is not rendered correctly depending on Java version
